Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not after); 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not before)
Name: Cup
Description: Small cup with a barely noticeable small ring base, flared body and thinned vertical lip. The clay is coarse, heterogeneous, flaky and orange. The vessel has been entirely polished, although the rim is painted with pinkish-red circle and the interior surface is strewn with drips of that same paint.
